intro: Dichapetalum baillonii, commonly known as the Bailloni's dichapetalum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are ovate and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are woody and somewhat branched. This species is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
